Posts.Content: Llroseworld wrote: I have stage 2 IDC HR+ and will begin dose dense chemo every two weeks and will have 4 treatments followed by radiation. Anyone else gone the dose dense route? If so what was your experience? I begin in May. Dx 3/8/2016, IDC, Left, 3cm, Stage IIA, ER+, HER2- Chemotherapy 6/17/2016 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dose dense chemo Llroseworld Llroseworld

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2016 02:31PM Llroseworld wrote: I had a very similar experience. They won't begin surgery until wound is completely healed. If the breast is red, skin is thickened or swelling you need ho have it checked out for cellulitis. I pray all goes well
Posts.Title: can a seroma delay the start of chemo Birchmore48 Birchmore48

Posts.Content: May 8, 2016 09:55PM Llroseworld wrote: I will begin dose dense chemo in two weeks. I have IDC stage 2 HR+. Had partial mycetomy with 2 +nodes. Had infection 3 weeks after surgery so now on wound vac healing. Please post how your experience with dose dense chemo is.
